Test Name: Antimicrobial Susceptibility Testing (AST) on Aerobic Bacteria
Specimen Type: Pure culture isolate of aerobic bacteria
Purpose: To assess the sensitivity of aerobic bacteria to antimicrobial agents and guide appropriate antibiotic therapy.
Equipment: Mueller-Hinton agar plates, antimicrobial susceptibility disks or E-test strips, incubator (35–37 °C), McFarland turbidity standard, sterile swabs, forceps
